page.title: 08DEADMAN'S DINGLE
page.content: {Deadman's Dingle}is an old tale which we found out from someone in {Picklescott.}It is a little place just outside{Woolstaston.} The tale is that many years ago a man fell in a dingle when it was snowing and was covered up for a few days. When they found him he was dead. The trouble was that the dingle was right in the middle of the boundary between two parishes,so they were arguing which one should bury him. In the end neither of them would bury him,so he was left there. Now it is said that he haunts the place where he died.
